MS MCQs

    Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure - Configure replication of on-premises virtual machines

    »

    1. You’ve confirmed your target region for migration to East US in Azure Migrate Server Migration. You decide you need to replicate and migrate your on-premises VMs to West US instead. What should you do?

      Change the target region in Azure Migrate Server Migration.

      Create a new Azure Migrate project and set the target region to West US.

      Use Azure Site Recovery to move your VMs from East US to West US.


    2. While configuring replication of your on-premises VMS, you discover one of the recommended Azure VM sizes doesn’t support the equivalent on-premises VM configuration. What should you do?

      Change the disk type from Standard HDD to Premium-managed disk.

      Exclude data disks to reduce the Azure VM size.

      Pick another VM size that supports the on-premises configuration.
